title: Feltpen in use...
content:
While not exactly a showcase of exemplary typography this is the first instance I have observed Feltpen in the wild.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015213106im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/advert_1_4942.jpg)

[http://www.cathkidston.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015213106/http:/www.cathkidston.co.uk/ "http://www.cathkidston.co.uk")  
 [http://www.linotype.com/13814/linotypefeltpenmedium-font.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015213106/http:/www.linotype.com/13814/linotypefeltpenmedium-font.html "http://www.linotype.com/13814/linotypefeltpenmedium-font.html")

A little rustic, but not too much.

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content:
The script doesn’t go well with the baggies, a more formal, more calm choice would have been better. Or a more “casual feminine” choice. And the strong red color communicates cheap stuff, which i don’t think they wanted to get.  
My 2 euro cents
